intro: Rapanea perforata var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid perforate woodbine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a distinctive perforation near the base, giving it its scientific name. The rigid varietal form is distinguished by its more upright growth habit compared to the typical variety.
